Package mmj.gmff

Class EscapePair

java.lang.Object
mmj.gmff.EscapePair
public class EscapePair extends Object
EscapesPair is a companion class to GMFFUserTextEscapes which holds a single escape char number and its replacement text.

Metamath allows only 7-bit ASCII characters but EscapesPair accomodates 8 bits just to avoid having to answer questions :-)

It is basically just a data structure with some attached utility functions on the data elements.

The reason for creating this class is that GMFF parameter type RunParms are not validated and processed until GMFF is initialized, typically when the user requests an export. So the RunParms are cached until initialization time.

  • Constructor Details

    • EscapePair

      public EscapePair(int num, String replacement)
      Standard constructor.

      No validation is done at this time. Just load the data structure.

      Parameters:
      num - the escaped character's numeric value
      replacement - the text which replaces the escaped character.

  • Method Details

    • validateEscapePair

      public void validateEscapePair(String exportType) throws GMFFException
      Validates the Num and Replacement fields individually.
      Parameters:
      exportType - the export type, for error reporting
      Throws:
      GMFFException - if error found.

    • validateNum

      public void validateNum(String exportType) throws GMFFException
      Validates the Num field.

      Num must be > -1 and < 256.

      Parameters:
      exportType - the export type, for error reporting
      Throws:
      GMFFException - if error found.

    • validateReplacement

      public void validateReplacement(String exportType) throws GMFFException
      Validates the Replacement field

      Replacement must not be null and not an empty String.

      Parameters:
      exportType - the export type, for error reporting
      Throws:
      GMFFException - if error found.
